thread.title: Girl celebrates second birthday after defying odds | Central
thread.title_full: Girl celebrates second birthday after defying odds | Central - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Girl celebrates second birthday after defying odds | Central
text:
Nusaybah Ahmed, who has survived despite being born with only half a heart, has celebrated her second birthday this month.
It was a party parents Zaid and Gulshaz, from Sparkhill in Birmingham feared the child would never see.
Gulshaz was given the option of abortion when the rare hypoplastic left heart syndrome was discovered at a 20-week scan.
Doctors at Birmingham Women’s Hospital feared Nusaybah would not survive 28 weeks in the womb.
Only 11 hours after being born, Nusaybah underwent a six-hour, life or death operation at Birmingham Children’s Hospital. Another major op took place last July and Nusaybah faces yet another when she’s three.
In all, she has already undergone surgery seven times in her life.
Nusaybah and her dad Zaid Credit: BPM She’s shown that the experts don’t always get it right.
The second operation was the most risky. When we handed Nusaybah to the surgeon, we kissed her goodbye.
– Nusaybah Ahmed's dad, Zaid Nusaybah and her siblings Credit: BPM For Nusaybah, a simple infection could be catastrophic. For that reason, she cannot attend nursery.
Today, she looks like any other healthy toddler, with only the tube attached to her nose. The birth defect prevents the heart’s left side developing.
Nusaybah was born naturally and weighed a healthy seven pounds.
She spent the first nine months of her life in hospital and the parents underwent training before their daughter was allowed to go home.
We were taught life-saving. And because of the risk of cardiac arrest, an alarm system was installed.
Children are a blessing and bring so much joy and happiness into your life. They make you appreciate what you have.
– Nusaybah Ahmed's dad, Zaid Last updated Sun 26 Feb 2017 Health West Midlands Birmingham
